responses: This is absolutely true. In fact, there are lots of induction cookware, and pans are made with special characteristics that make them more heat-efficient. Also, the pan and the pan holder (the part that you put the pan on top of) need to be non-magnetic, or the induction cooker won’t work as well.

Most of the time, you can use any metal pan. However, if you are cooking something that has to be served really hot (such as pancakes, but not scrambled eggs, for example), then it might be a good idea to use a pan that has a protective bottom that is not susceptible to heat damage.
